Here's the reason why
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55875b9363687278b00026ed#post_55875b9363687278b00026ed
Bethesda knocked it out of the park at E3.
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55875ce163687251ce00097b#post_55875ce163687251ce00097b
Here's my honest opinion as to why the anti-gay marriage movement is throwing such a shitfit over this; if you're familiar with the idea of a cultural hegemony you'll understand where I'm going with this.

Basically the most powerful country in the world culturally effects other countries by essentially bleeding their cultural into other cultures and vice versa.  Like how the romans were effected by the greeks and roman culture bleed through to other countries.


If gay marriage is legalized in the usa then chances are other countries are going to start legalizing it one after the other.

My guess is that asia is next on the list; asia is anti-glbt, but primarily because of tradition.  Fighting against tradition is way easier than fighting against religious belief.  IE how japan legalized civil unions, the difference is in this case under legal law in japan civil unions are effectively the same thing unlike how in the usa it was a bastardized version.  What I mean by all this is that what is probably going to happen is that over the next twenty years the overwhelming majority of civilized countries will legalize gay marriage, china will probably legalize it, india will probably, etc, etc until the only wide scale regions left are in the middle east and africa.  Sure say individual countries here and there like north korea will still be illegal, but you get what I'm saying.
